posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
Hi everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.77.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Chat folders let you organize your organizations, group your groups, and individualize your individuals into unique folders that are easy to customize and rearrange. Display unread messages from your favorite people, filter by chat type (1-on-1 and groups), or create separate folders like “Personal” and “Work” so you can quickly see the messages that are relevant to you. Enable chat folders in Settings > Chats to get started.

  • This update also includes a bugfix for an issue that prevented link previews from being generated when the message also included emoji characters. Thanks, @elias6!

Commit changes: Comparing v7.76.0-beta.1…v7.77.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.76 release
Option to *group* chats / create chat folders

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.77.0-beta.1

55 new commits since 7.76.0-beta.2:

Show commits

  • v7.77.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Improve typing indicator sending/receiving behavior [2]

  • Make verified notifications consistent [3]

  • Remove window.textsecure global [4]

  • Remove window.Signal.Services.storage [5]

  • Log when we clear profile name [6]

  • Remove a bunch more global variables [7]

  • safePoll shouldn't produce error messages [8]

  • Use mp4san [9]

  • Increase sender certificate expiration buffer [10]

  • Remove window.Signal.Migrations [11]

  • Remove window.i18n in favor of SignalContext.i18n [12]

  • Add extra calling error modal [13]

  • Remove window.getAccountManager [14]

  • Chat folders bugfixes & ui updates [15]

  • Improve attachment handling of edits [16]

  • Fix calling dev tools window [17]

  • Update emoji search index to version 15 [18]

  • Re-use standard attachments on edit [19]

  • Fix context menu trigger on chat folders overview [20]

  • Action to schedule Linux reproducible builds [21]

  • Refine signal connections definition [22]

  • Linux: Fix StartupWMClass to fix app icon [23]

  • Refactor backup subscription UI [24]

  • Setup dependabot for github-actions [25]

  • Fix typo in notification profiles setting [26]

  • Linux: Fix X11 app icon by updating desktopName and wm_class [27]

  • Update github action versions [28]

  • Reenable actions/setup-node cache [29]

  • Fix Linux wm class for alpha [30]

  • Release notes for 7.76 [31]

  • Update strings [32]

  • Update DNS fallback [33]

  • Improve profile key validation [34]

  • Disable chat folder filtering when feature is disabled [35]

  • Prepare for adding file suffixes [36]

  • Rename files [37]

  • Suffix lint rule and fixes [38]

  • Migrate all preferences buttons to axo button [39]

  • Add shortcuts for add/remove chat to chat folder [40]

  • Remember scroll position in chats [41]

  • Improve timeline layout rendering [42]

  • Adjust timeline message scroll targeting to use scrollIntoView [43]

  • Add ability to send poll create messages [44]

  • Notification Profiles: Normalize ids [45]

  • Add ability to send poll votes [46]

  • Update symbols font [47]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.59.2 [48]

  • Adjust conversation search rankings for archived conversations [49]

  • Improve marking messages read after wheel event when unfocused [50]

  • Fix lost drafts when restoring chat scroll position [51]

  • Fix reference to build-localized-display-names script [52]

  • Release notes for 7.77 [53]

  • Update strings [54]

  • 7.77.0-beta.1 [55]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.76.0-beta.2…v7.77.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

Something is wrong with the sticker pack creator. When picking emojis for individual stickers, the emojis are just all over the place. They’re completely out of order and the search is not even working as it’s not bringing up the correct emojis. There also seem to be a bunch of emojis that are just missing. I do not know when exactly this happened. I’ve attached a screenshot.

Screenshot from 2025-10-23 13-30-54355×450 97.6 KB

posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked: Apologies, if you restart the app it should now be enabled for you
Yes, it’s showing up now! Thank you <3 I appreciate it.
Unlike in the Android version, the unread counters of chat folders only counts unmuted conversations.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked: chat folders are neat, thank you!

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
some little bugs:

  1. the “no connection” indicator is a bit tight with the folder selector, when the sidebar is collapsed:

    image402×384 3.8 KB

  2. received a notification from a 1:1 chat that’s not in my current folder (explicitly excluded), tapping on the notification put it in that folder visually (until i switched folders) which felt a bit unexpected/disturbing. i feel like maybe switching to the first (in the user-defined order) folder that contains this chat could be better instead?

posts.cooked:

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: Sorry about this. Do you see anything in Documents tab? Is there visual media (images, videos, gifs) in that chat?

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked: There are both documents and media. And yes, all the conversations which show as empty have media attachments within them.

posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked: Sorry, we’re specifically wondering if you go to “All Media > Documents” tab if that also appears empty? Or if its just the “All Media > Media” tab that is broken

When trying to upload several .HEIC photographs, I get an error stating ‘I can only upload one file at a time’. Is this expected behavior? This doesn’t happen while uploading .PNG photographs, for example.

Screenshot from 2025-10-30 13-33-33259×170 2.66 KB

Sorry no debug log. I’m having trouble uploading the log

Screenshot from 2025-10-30 13-45-25336×134 9.87 KB

Whenever you delete the call history on desktop, a little rectangular box appears in the bottom left of the screen confirming the deletion of the history. Is there any way you can make it disappear a little faster?

When I delete the call history and want to move on to other parts of the app (for instance: when wanting to see reactions to a story), the box moves to the bottom middle and gets in the way of the UI, blocking me from being able to press on the story context menu (views, comments) button.
